page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND POPULATION
page.content: This area is dominated by the hills of{Trink,Trencrom}and{Trendrine.}It is very rural having a low population centred mainly on the three villages of{Halsetown,Nancledra}and{Towednack. { }The area changed gradually during the last ten years because of {Government subsidies}to hill farmers. As a result traditional moorland areas have been ploughed up and the ground has been fertilised to produce intensively managed grassland.Most of the farming is dairy but there is a move towards more diversification of crops. There has been an{increase of {population}in the area and some of these people have been accommodated in buildings which had a former use.Piggeries,stables and farm buildings have been converted into very attractive dwellings.
